god_text: Coatlicue. An earth-goddess; symbol of the earth both as a creator and destroyer; patron of childbirth; associated with warfare; governance; and agriculture; gave birth to many gods; among which is Huitzilopochtli Affiliation: quetzal, toxcatl, creatrix, teocalli, virgin, goddess, tula, creatress, mediatrix, rhea.

Ehecatl. God of air and winds; especially those that bring rains; an aspect of Queztalcoatl that helped create humanity; associated with the west; regarded as the patron of merchants Affiliation: rumbler, quetzal, toxcatl, zac, sleety, jaguar, subfix, gusty, nito, uayeb.

Huitzilopochtli. God of the sun; war; and sacrifice; patron of Tenochtitlan; lord of the south; associated with hummingbirds and eagles Affiliation: toxcatl, quetzal, jaguar, maize, teocalli, hummingbird, deity, tula, macaw, pulque.

Mixcoatl. God of the hunt; identified with the Milky Way and the stars and heavens; father of the southern constellations and of Quetzalcoatl Affiliation: toxcatl, quetzal, rumbler, jaguar, hummingbird, deity, atlatl, ocelot, phallical, thunderbird.

Quetzalcoatl. God of the wind; rain; and sky; and also considered god of learning; science; agriculture; crafts; and the arts; creator of the world and humanity; patron of priests and merchants; credited with the discovery of maize Affiliation: quetzal, tula, jaguar, hummingbird, toxcatl, deity, teocalli, maize, god, cacique.

Tezcatlipoca. God of obsidian and the night sky; specifically also the Great Bear constellation; also known as The Smoking Mirror; the 'Hummingbird Sorcerer'; the 'Flayed One'; and more; embodiment of change through conflict Affiliation: toxcatl, quetzal, deity, jaguar, maize, hummingbird, macaw, teocalli, god, manito.

Tlaloc. God of rain; storms; water; lightning; and agriculture; ruler of Tlalocan; a separate underworld consisting of those who died from drowning Affiliation: toxcatl, jaguar, quetzal, maize, glyph, buccal, deity, teocalli, crocodilian, rayed.

Xiuhtecuhtli. God of fire; day; and heat; closely associated with young warriors and rulers; overseer of the Toxiuhmolpilia festival that is held to ensure the successful renewal of the sun Affiliation: macaw, zoomorph, glyph, plumula, winkelman, piperno, codex, quincunx, glyphic, quadripartite.

Xochiquetzal. Goddess of beauty; sexual love; and household arts; associated with flowers and plants; protector of young mothers; and patron of pregnancy; childbirth; and crafts practiced by women Affiliation: toxcatl, quetzal, maize, hummingbird, goddess, patroness, bisexual, androgynous, creatrix, jaguar.
Inti. Sun god and progenitor of the Incan ruling family Affiliation: rial, relationship, macies, yerba, intimate, interaction, avian, links, phenomenologically, metaphoric.
Kon. god of rain and the southerly wind; creator of humans Affiliation: kan, berust, karo.
Pachacamac. creator of humans; associated with earthquakes and the Pachacamac temple's Oracle Affiliation: chincha, huaca, teocalli, teopan, balboa, deity, cacique, creator, huaco, quetzal.
Pachamama. earth goddess; embodied by the mountains and the cause of earthquakes Affiliation: huaco, altiplano, jerez, castellano, chincha.

Chaac. god of rain Affiliation: chaa, mool, guaiac, mechoacan, obispo, indican, rakan.
Ekchuah. god of war Affiliation: toxcatl, bloodletter, quetzal, zac, paddler, cruller, ophite, forgiver, codical, tonalamatl.
Ixchel. goddess of childbirth and war Affiliation: chebel, rumal, dominicale, sarbacane, pungi.

Arianrhod. an earth mother goddess; moon Affiliation: ethal, cumal, druidess, howel, llyn, asteria, hilding, gorlois, underwave.
Arawn. god of the underworld; terror; revenge; and war Affiliation: ethal, oisin, fosterling, cumal, cumhal, gorlois, howel, seneschal, hersir, sith.
Aoibhell. woman of the shide; who made her dwelling in Craig Liath; Legend has it that she gave a golden harp to Meardha. Affiliation: .
Badb. goddess of destruction and war Affiliation: ulster, brugh, loch, mac, banshee, druid, druidess, sidhe, cumal, connaught.

Balor. Although he was born with two good eyes; one was ruined in an accident; the eye is so hideous that he only opens it in battle so that its venom will slay whoever is unlucky enough to catch glimpse of it; his daughter marries Cian. Also known as Balor of the Evil Eye. Affiliation: cumal, druidess, druid, cumhal, ethal, oisin, mac, troll, giantess, ulster.

Blodeuwedd. a maiden; She was changed into an owl for extramarital sex and for plotting to kill Lleu. Symbolizes wisdom; lunar mysteries; initiations. Known to help a garden or a child grow. Known as the ninefold goddess of the Western Isles of Paradise and Flower-Face; goddess was created by Math and Gwydion as a wife for the god Lleu Affiliation: llyn, ogress, hersir, ethal, cumal, gorlois, druidess, maiden, traitorously, perjurous.
Boann. Goddess of rivers Affiliation: brugh, ethal, dee, asterion, ribble, cumal, underwave, lough, druidess, connaught.
Brigid. Goddess of poetry; fertility; protector of all who call upon her; healing; a maiden; a triple goddess Affiliation: underwave.
Bran. god of health Affiliation: whey, flaxseed, barley, oatmeal, oisin, milk, sawdust, buttermilk, groats, cumhal.
Branwen. goddess of love and beauty. Affiliation: cumal, connaught, howel, ethal, druidess, bran, cumhal, llyn, henwife, pendragon.
Bris. god of fertility and agriculture. Affiliation: parture, livered, stroy, stroyer, finitive, cadent, fensive, olid, scribing, ribber.

Camulus. god of war of the Belgic Remi and British Trinovantes Affiliation: penda, vexillum, limma, crista.
Caswallawn. god of war Affiliation: bego, forkbeard, penda, boort, underwave, pendragon, ironside, gaut, ethal, birlinn.
Ceridwen. Inspiration; childbirth/midwifery; magic; moon; wisdom Affiliation: druid, sorceress, inro, witch, druidess, bran, rhe, changeling, cumhal, bitch.
Cian. Farther of Lugh Affiliation: cal, cine, educator, mathematician, physician, pedagogue, scholar, knowledgeable, semilegendary, cist.
Creiddylad. Goddess of flowers; love. Affiliation: hydric.
Cyhiraeth. Goddess of streams; her scream fortells death. Coincides with the Beansidhe or Banshee Affiliation: mandarah, anthraquinone, yolden, addax, iliau, morg, antecessor, tach, pilocarpine.

Dylan. sea god Affiliation: starring, movie, bob, jerry, brewster, powwow, jazz, film, clint, newsreel.

Morrigan. Goddess of destruction; fertility; moon; vegetation; war; a triple goddessMacha - Irish goddess associated with war; horses; and sovereignty; member of the MorriganNemain - Irish goddess of the frenzied havoc of war; member of the MorriganAnu - Manifestation magic; moon; air; fertility; prosperity. Celtic (Irish) goddess of plenty. Affiliation: bard, aneurin, merlin, oisin, druidess, cumhal, druid, minstrel, ballad, welsh.
